newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BRL OK with analysts' profit forecast.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BRL OK with analysts' profit forecast.

text.p: Australia's second largest wine producer BRL Hardy Ltd said on Friday it was not uncomfortable with analysts' forecast for a 20 percent rise in net profit before abnormals for calendar 1996.
"We're not uncomfortable with those projections," said managing director Stephen Millar told reporters after a Securities Institute of Australia briefing.
BRL reported a 21 percent rise in operating profit to A$13.33 million for the six months to June 30 and said it was targetting similar growth in the second half of 1996.
Millar said the company was set next year to launch a new premium Chilean wine brand on the United Kingdom in a 50 percent joint venture with a Chilean producer.
BRL Europe managing director Christopher Carson said he expected the new venture to become a "500,000 case a year" brand, with sales to the U.K. of more than 150,000 cases in the second full year.

Millar said French winery L'Occitane, a substantial co-operative winery group in the Midi region of france, could move to 20 percent of equity in BRL's French winery Domaine de la Baume if it chose to.
However, BRL did not give up its majority position.
BRL earlier announced that L'Occitane had acquired an initial equity interest of 10 percent in La Baume SA, BRL's French holding company, as part of a long term strategic alliance.
